creator: mail@martinjgreen.me.uk
text:
I try to build apache2 (same problem with both 2.0.55 and 2.2.0) on Slackware 
using kernel 2.6.15.4 with configure options:

CFLAGS="-O2 -pipe -march=pentium4 -mtune=pentium4 -fomit-frame-pointer" 
CXXFLAGS=$CFLAGS \
./configure \
--enable-layout=Slack \
--enable-modules=most \
--enable-so \
--disable-cgid \
--disable-speling \
--disable-ldap \
--disable-proxy \
--enable-rewrite=shared \
--enable-include=shared \
--enable-ext-filter=shared \
--enable-env=shared \
--enable-expires=shared \
--enable-headers=shared \
--enable-setenvif=shared \
--disable-dav \
--disable-status \
--disable-info \
--enable-asis=shared \
--enable-vhost-alias=shared \
--enable-imap=shared \
--enable-actions=shared \
--enable-mime-magic=shared \
--enable-ssl=shared >> /root/apache.build

Configure fails with error:
configure: error: mod_so has been requested but cannot be built on your system

I've also tried compiling APR (downloaded separately from apache.org) and I 
get the same error telling me DSO support is not available.

Please note: I have a pre-built slackware binary package installed and working 
perfectly with shared modules. Its only the compile which has problems.

creator: mail@martinjgreen.me.uk
